Several museums have been built these years to show the spirit of Suzhou. There are three most popular ones: (Suzhou Silk Museum)/ (Suzhou Museum)/ (Suzhou Garden Museum). Which one would you like to know first? (Btw my fav is Suzhou Museum. The museum itself is already a piece of art 😍）
Here's some info about suzhou silk museum...
The Suzhou Museum is a museum of ancient Chinese art, ancient Chinese paintings, calligraphy, and handmade crafts. Admission is free!!!! Trust me you'll DEFINITELY be amazed by it!

Only this place? There are even more worth exploring in this city, do you want to try other attractions?

Hanshan Temple; literally: "Cold Mountain Temple", is a Buddhist temple and monastery in Suzhou, China. It is located at the town of Fengqiao, about 5 kilometres west of the old city of Suzhou. It was mentioned in several ancient poems, which made it more famous.
here's some info about xiyuan.

here's some info about ferris wheel

The Gate to the East, also known as the Gate of the Orient, is the current tallest building in Suzhou with 66 floors. It is intended to be a symbol of a gateway to the city, that emphasizes the city's continuing significance in modern China. Go visit!!! It does have a funny shape like a pair of pants... yes pants…
Loading infomation...

Recent years have witnessed great development in Suzhou with the appearances of many modern architectures, among which (Suzhou Ferris Wheel)/(Gate to the East) stand out. Which would you like to know? (FYI Gate to the East has really interesting appearance, worth a visit 😜）

values: Here's some information about jinji and things you might wan to do:...
Loading infomation...
Here's some information about jinji and things you might wan to do:...

Lucky you!!! Suzhou is known as one of the water towns and many lakes lie in this city. As a local, I highly recommend these: (Jinji Lake) / (Lake Shi) / (Lake Tai). Which one would you like to know more about?

Lake Tai or Lake Taihu is a large freshwater lake in the Yangtze Delta plain. The lake belongs to Jiangsu and the southern shore forms its border with Zhejiang. So here are something you could do on Suzhou side: visit Xishan island and enjoy the fresh air in Xishan forest park; wander around Lake Tai national wetland park; chill in Taihu National Holiday resort …
